instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2877 Screen causing shotdown
threads.message:
No liquid damage. Never worked on one of these.


With no internal screen it runs. Connect screen, there is no backlight and the machine shuts down.
I'm guessing something is detecting and over current or over voltage and shutting the macine down.

This machine is one off of the shit pile. I will get around to looking at the schematic but wondered if anyone had a fast answer for me please?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2877 Screen causing shotdown
threads.message: Be aware taht LVDS cable is not the same has A1278..

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2877 Screen causing shotdown
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 24072"]Be aware taht LVDS cable is not the same has A1278..[/QUOTE]

Got it one!. I was using a regular 13" test screen with LVDS cable. Changed for the native cable and she works :)
We'll keep that one as a shop machine. Cheers :)
